entries.title: Project Setup and Cargo Initialization
entries.approach: Initialized a new Rust project using `file` operations to simulate `cargo new`. Manually created `Cargo.toml` and `src/main.rs` with basic content and added the `clap` dependency. Verified using `cargo test` (which passed since no actual tests were written yet).
learnings: The `test` tool returns success even if no tests are found, as long as the test runner command executes without errors.

entries.title: Implement Core 'Hello, World!' Functionality
entries.approach: Modified `src/main.rs` to parse arguments with `clap` (even though no arguments are defined yet) and confirmed that the 'Hello, World!' output and zero exit status still work with the new test setup in `cli_output.rs`. I had to update `Cargo.toml` to specify the test path for `cli_output.rs` and run `cargo test --package hello-world-cli` to correctly run the tests for the specific package.
learnings: It is important to specify the package name when running `cargo test` in a workspace to ensure only relevant tests are executed.
gotchas: Running `cargo test` without specifying a package or test name will run tests in all packages in the workspace. To run tests for a specific package, use `cargo test --package <package_name>`. To run a specific test file, `cargo test --test <test_file_name>`. This caused some confusion initially as the `test` tool's default `path` argument was not being correctly interpreted as a test *target*.

entries.title: Define CLI Structure with Clap
entries.approach: Created `src/cli.rs` to house the `clap` CLI structure. Updated `src/main.rs` to use the `Cli` struct from `src/cli.rs`. Verified that existing tests still pass. This ensures a modular and organized project structure, ready for further CLI argument additions.
learnings: Separating CLI definition into its own module (`cli.rs`) improves code organization and readability.

entries.title: Implement Help and Version Display
entries.approach: Integrated `clap`'s automatic help and version generation by adding the `authors` and `description` fields to `Cargo.toml`. Also added new integration tests in `cli_output.rs` to verify the `--help` and `--version` output and exit codes. Modified `main.rs` to remove the `println!("Hello, world!")` as `clap` exits after printing help/version.
learnings: `clap` automatically handles `--help` and `--version` flags based on the `Cargo.toml` metadata and `#[command]` attributes, simplifying CLI development.

To include custom assertions for the output of help/version, additional integration tests were created in `cli_output.rs`. It's important to use `env!("CARGO_PKG_VERSION")` to correctly assert the version output.

entries.title: Implement Invalid Argument Handling
entries.approach: Implemented invalid argument handling using `clap`'s `try_parse()` method. When an invalid argument is encountered, `clap` prints a descriptive error message to stderr, and the application exits with a non-zero status code (1). Added a new integration test to `cli_output.rs` to verify this behavior: checking for a non-zero exit status and the presence of an expected error message in stderr, while ensuring that "Hello, world!" is not printed to stdout.
learnings: `clap::Parser::try_parse()` allows for custom error handling and ensures a non-zero exit code on invalid arguments.
It's important to differentiate between `stdout` and `stderr` when testing CLI applications for output and errors.

entries.title: Create Message Handler Component and Refactor Output
entries.approach: Created `src/message_handler.rs` with a `print_hello_world` function. Modified `src/main.rs` to import and use this function, ensuring that all existing CLI functionalities (default output, help, version, and error handling) remain unchanged. Added a new integration test to `cli_output.rs` to specifically check for proper error message printing and non-zero exit for invalid arguments.
learnings: Encapsulating output logic in a dedicated module (e.g., `message_handler.rs`) improves modularity and makes the codebase easier to maintain and extend.
Updating test files to reflect changes in `main.rs` is crucial to ensure continued correctness of the application's behavior.
